qas.question: How many people can fit in the Theatre Royal?
What is the capacity of Drum Theatre?
What is the cost of admission to the Plymouth City Museum and Art Gallery?
How many galleries are present in the Plymouth City Museum and Art Gallery?
When did the theater in the Plymouth Athenaeum close?

context: The city's main theatres are the Theatre Royal (<a0_0>1,315<a0_0/> capacity), its Drum Theatre (<a1_0>200<a1_0/> capacity), and its production and creative learning centre, The TR2. The Plymouth Pavilions has multiple uses for the city staging music concerts, basketball matches and stand-up comedy. There are also three cinemas: Reel Cinema at Derrys Cross, Plymouth Arts Centre at Looe Street and a Vue cinema at the Barbican Leisure Park. The Plymouth City Museum and Art Gallery is operated by Plymouth City Council allowing <a2_0>free<a2_0/> admission – it has <a3_0>six<a3_0/> galleries. The Plymouth Athenaeum, which includes a local interest library, is a society dedicated to the promotion of learning in the fields of science, technology, literature and art. From 1961 to <a4_0>2009<a4_0/> it also housed a theatre.
